reasoning: Hereditary RCC comprises approximately 3-5% of all RCC cases. With global RCC incidence at ~9-10 per 100k, hereditary RCC estimated at 0.45 per 100k. Includes VHL syndrome, hereditary papillary RCC, Birt-Hogg-Dub√© syndrome, and familial RCC. Confidence moderate due to variation in hereditary proportion estimates across populations and incomplete penetrance of genetic syndromes.
source: GLOBOCAN 2020 (IARC) for RCC incidence; Linehan et al. (2010). Hereditary renal cell carcinoma syndromes. J Urol. 184(2):459-465
